## Introduction

When there's no fan or pump, temperature differences themselves drive flow through buoyancy. This is **natural** (or **free**) convection.

<!-- TODO: Add content from Lecture 3.5 transcripts -->

## The Driving Force: Buoyancy

$$F_\text{buoyancy} = \rho_\infty g \beta (T - T_\infty) \cdot V$$

where $\beta$ is the volumetric thermal expansion coefficient:

$$\beta = -\frac{1}{\rho}\left(\frac{\partial \rho}{\partial T}\right)_p$$

For ideal gases: $\beta = 1/T$

## Grashof and Rayleigh Numbers

$$\text{Gr} = \frac{g \beta \Delta T L^3}{\nu^2}$$

$$\text{Ra} = \text{Gr} \cdot \text{Pr} = \frac{g \beta \Delta T L^3}{\nu \alpha}$$
